paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the KCNH2 gene, specifically the I663P variant, and its implications in drug binding and cardiac arrhythmias.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Experiences syncope and has a family history of LQT2.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The patient presented with syncope at age 20 and was diagnosed with LQT2 at age 22.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Diagnosed with LQT2 after experiencing arrhythmias.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The patient was diagnosed with LQT2 at age 29 after experiencing arrhythmias.

individual_records.phenotype_details: No symptoms reported, but carries the variant.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: This individual is a carrier of the I663P variant but remains asymptomatic.

functional_data.summary: The I663P mutation results in constitutively active hERG channels that do not deactivate.

variants.segregation_data: The I663P variant segregates with LQT2 in affected families.
variants.additional_notes: The I663P variant is associated with high-affinity drug binding.
key_quotes: The I663P mutation produces constitutively active hERG channels that do not appear to deactivate.
The extent of block does not correlate with the extent of inactivation.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the KCNH2 gene variant I663P was successfully extracted.
